results.title: Eric & Ernie's Xmas Show = The Morecambe & Wise Christmas Show
results.brief_description: A selection of comedy sketches by one of Britain’s favourite TV comedy duos, Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise, from their Christmas shows. Guests include Peter Barkworth, Peter Cushing, Hannah Gordon, Glenda Jackson, Mick McManus, Gemma Craven, Jill Gascoine, Sir Alec Guinness, Peter Vaughan.

results.title: Ergonomics: the practical approach
results.brief_description: Ergonomics is the study of the relationship between people, the equipment they use, and the physical environment in which they work. Ergonomics is a continuous process which aims to improve productivity and health through practical measures which reduce difficult situations. This program and guide looks at how ergonomics is applied, static and dynamic muscular effort, visual controls and displays, as well as a follow up questionnaire.

results.title: Ergon-office
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: Designed to promote an awareness of ergonomic hazards in the office. Emphasis is placed on the hazards induced by new technology such as VDU terminals and printers.

results.title: Eradicate the enemy
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: Advocates the popularising of the BCG vaccine to fight tuberculosis. BCG or Bacillus Calmette Guerin was developed at the Pasteur Institute in Paris after many years of research. It was first tested on human beings in 1921 and proved an inexpensive, speedy and effective method for the prevention and eradication of tuberculosis.

results.title: ERA : the Educational Reform Association School (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film gives an impression of the philosophies, day-to-day experiences and development of pupils at the Education Reform Association School at Donvale, Victoria. Students and staff together discuss the aims of the school programme, hopefully providing evidence for greater freedom in all our educational institutions

results.title: Equipment
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions on how to clean kitchen equipment; loosen, dissolve and emulsify dirt; rinse and dry equipment; and prevent food poisoning.

results.title: Equilibrium: the limit of disorder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Defines equilibrium as a state of balance between the conflicting requirements for minimum internal energy and maximum entropy of a system and shows that free energy is at a minimum in the condition of equilibrium. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Equilibrium
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Deals with three questions: What is chemical equilibrium? How does the chemist recognise it? How does he explain it? In answering the questions the film stresses the dynamic nature of equilibrium. An Analogy in terms of fish population in two connected bowls, and animation using molecular models, present the concepts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.creator_credit: Ken Stein, Best Films, New Jersey Public Television, Paul Buck and Art Ciocco
